_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto.  Shutoff at 85%, min. class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane Blending System consisting of one (1) vessel plus lines.  Butane (liquefied and stored under pressure), is blended via direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the cold season.

_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: City of Chesapeake Off. of Emg. Mgt

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan Liquids Terminals, LLC - Chesapeake Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the Butane Blending System, including the associated piping and one 60,000 gallon butane storage vessel.  KMLT owns the real property associated with the Butane Blending System.  Energy Transfer LP (ET) owns all the equipment associated with the Butane Blending System.  Energy Transfer LP and KMLT each have operational responsibilities for the Butane Blending System.   ET controls and monitors all butane blending operations remotely from its control center located near Houston, Texas, conducts all maintenance activities, and schedules the delivery of butane trucks.  KMLT oversees the unloading of butane trucks into the storage vessel and conducts routine visual inspections.



Energy Transfer LP constructed the Butane Blending System in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) No. 58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage.  Energy Transfer LP designed, constructed, and maintains the Butane Blending System in accordance with NFPA No. 58 and the manufacturer's instructions and recommendations.



It is the Parties' policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the Parties' policy to notify the Chesapeake Fire Department as well as the City of Chesapeake Office of Emergency Management.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services and the Sentara Norfolk General Hospital, Norfolk, Virginia, which is the nearest full service hospital/emergency department.



Chesapeake Terminal has evaluated and reported a worst-case release scenario and an alternative, more credible, scenario.



The Parties comply with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and

Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  This facility has not had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Butane Blending System, it is the Parties' policy to initially contact the owner of the equipment - Energy Transfer LP and the local fire department.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the local fire department.  The Chesapeake Fire Department personnel have participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessel, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.  Note: In contrast to the PSM requirements, this "stationary source" as defined under 40 CFR Part 68 is bounded by the off-load station and the points of injection. 



The Parties actively seek employee input on process safety improvements.  Additionally, the Chesapeake Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
